H.text: George Pataki is the New York Governor.
H.ref: New York Governor George Pataki joined victims' family members, survivors, and rescue workers Thursday in laying out a timetable for two temporary Sept. 11 memorials.

H.text: Debra Burlingame is a board member of the World Trade Center Memorial Foundation.
H.ref: This week, Debra Burlingame, a board member of the World Trade Center Memorial Foundation, and others called for a boycott of fundraising for the memorial until the International Freedom Center and the Drawing Center have been banished from ground zero.

H.text: A timetable for two temporary Sept. 11 memorials was laid out.
H.ref: New York Governor George Pataki joined victims' family members, survivors, and rescue workers Thursday in laying out a timetable for two temporary Sept. 11 memorials.

H.text: Some relatives of Sept. 11 victims called for a fund-raising boycott.
H.ref: In the ever fiercer fight over a year-old plan to build a home for the Drawing Center and the International Freedom Center alongside the World Trade Center memorial, some relatives of 9/11 victims called on Monday for a fund-raising boycott.

H.text: David Isay invited survivors and relatives of Sept. 11 victims to make the first recordings.
H.ref: For the Sept. 11 project, Isay invited survivors and relatives of victims to make the first recordings at Grand Central.

H.text: Critics of the cultural plan said the Freedom Center had to be removed.
H.ref: Despite that withdrawal, critics of the cultural plan -- including two members of the World Trade Center Memorial Foundation, which is charged with soliciting contributions -- said the freedom center had to be removed before they would support the use of public money for the overall project.

H.text: Critics of the cultural plan include two members of the World Trade Center Memorial Foundation.
H.ref: Despite that withdrawal, critics of the cultural plan -- including two members of the World Trade Center Memorial Foundation, which is charged with soliciting contributions -- said the freedom center had to be removed before they would support the use of public money for the overall project.

H.text: Debra Burlingame and others called for a boycott of fundraising for the World Trade Center Memorial until the International Freedom Center and the Drawing Center have been banished.
H.ref: This week, Debra Burlingame, a board member of the World Trade Center Memorial Foundation, and others called for a boycott of fundraising for the memorial until the International Freedom Center and the Drawing Center have been banished from ground zero.

H.text: Control of the St. Nicholas property was assumed by the City Department of Design and Construction after Sept. 11, 2001.
H.ref: Control of the property was assumed by the City Department of Design and Construction after Sept. 11, 2001.

H.text: George Pataki will use public dollars to jumpstart the fund-raising effort for the Sept. 11 memorial.
H.ref: He will also use hundreds of millions of public dollars to jumpstart the fund-raising effort for the Sept. 11 memorial at the World Trade Center site, they said, and will push ahead the timetable for producing a redesign of the Freedom Tower office building.

H.text: George Pataki will push ahead the timetable for producing a redesign of the Freedom Tower office building.
H.ref: He will also use hundreds of millions of public dollars to jumpstart the fund-raising effort for the Sept. 11 memorial at the World Trade Center site, they said, and will push ahead the timetable for producing a redesign of the Freedom Tower office building.

H.text: George Pataki will appoint his chief of staff to take control of the rebuilding effort in Lower Manhattan.
H.ref: Gov. George E. Pataki will appoint his chief of staff to take control of the rebuilding effort in Lower Manhattan, aides to the governor said last night.

H.text: The Freedom Tower will be redesigned because of security concerns.
H.ref: The Freedom Tower meant to rise from the World Trade Center's ashes will be redesigned because of security concerns, officials said this week.

H.text: Gretchen Dykstra led the redevelopment of Times Square.
H.ref: Gretchen Dykstra, the city consumer affairs commissioner, who previously led the redevelopment of Times Square, was named Thursday as president and chief executive of the foundation charged with raising more than $500 million for a memorial and two cultural buildings at ground zero.

H.text: Gretchen Dykstra was named as president of the World Trade Center Memorial Foundation.
H.ref: Gretchen Dykstra, the city consumer affairs commissioner, who previously led the redevelopment of Times Square, was named Thursday as president and chief executive of the foundation charged with raising more than $500 million for a memorial and two cultural buildings at ground zero.

H.text: The World Trade Center Memorial Foundation is charged with raising $500 million.
H.ref: Gretchen Dykstra, the city consumer affairs commissioner, who previously led the redevelopment of Times Square, was named Thursday as president and chief executive of the foundation charged with raising more than $500 million for a memorial and two cultural buildings at ground zero.

H.text: The World Trade Center Memorial Foundation was created to raise money.
H.ref: The World Trade Center Memorial Foundation was created in December to raise money and run the memorial and the cultural buildings, which include a performing arts center and museum.

H.text: The World Trade Center Memorial Foundation was created to run the memorial.
H.ref: The World Trade Center Memorial Foundation was created in December to raise money and run the memorial and the cultural buildings, which include a performing arts center and museum.

H.text: A performing arts center is one of the cultural buildings of the World Trade Center Memorial.
H.ref: The World Trade Center Memorial Foundation was created in December to raise money and run the memorial and the cultural buildings, which include a performing arts center and museum.

H.text: A museum is one of the cultural buildings of the World Trade Center Memorial.
H.ref: The World Trade Center Memorial Foundation was created in December to raise money and run the memorial and the cultural buildings, which include a performing arts center and museum.

H.text: John C. Whitehead is the chairman of the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation.
H.ref: At a news conference at the trade center site after the foundation's second board meeting Thursday, John C. Whitehead, the chairman of the development corporation, said the foundation began its fund-raising effort about two weeks ago and had already received large financial commitments.

H.text: Kevin M. Rampe is the president of the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation.
H.ref: Kevin M. Rampe, the president of the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation, which is overseeing the project and the public-comment process, said of the changes that "the reason the number of ramps was reduced from four to two was that our consultants told us that was the best way to provide security there."

H.text: Michael Arad won the design competition for the World Trade Center Memorial.
H.ref: When he won the design competition, Arad was only 34 and had never done anything nearly so big before, let alone at one of the most scrutinized architectural sites in the city's history.

H.text: The World Trade Center Memorial complex includes underground exhibits.
H.ref: Pataki, the aides said, will also energize the fund-raising effort for the planned memorial by earmarking $300 million in federal money for construction and maintenance of the complex, which includes a study center, underground exhibits and twin reflecting pools marking the footprints of the twin towers.

H.text: The World Trade Center Memorial complex includes twin reflecting pools.
H.ref: Pataki, the aides said, will also energize the fund-raising effort for the planned memorial by earmarking $300 million in federal money for construction and maintenance of the complex, which includes a study center, underground exhibits and twin reflecting pools marking the footprints of the twin towers.

H.text: The pools mark the footprints of the Twin Towers.
H.ref: Pataki, the aides said, will also energize the fund-raising effort for the planned memorial by earmarking $300 million in federal money for construction and maintenance of the complex, which includes a study center, underground exhibits and twin reflecting pools marking the footprints of the twin towers.

H.text: The World Trade Center Memorial is due to open in 2009.
H.ref: The permanent memorial, part of the trade center site redevelopment, is due to open in 2009.
